graph.algorithms.lrpartition

Class LRPartition<V extends Vertex,E extends Edge<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.algorithms.lrpartition.LRPartition<V,E>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The vertex type
    E - The edge type

    public class LRPartition<V extends Vertex,E extends Edge<V>>
extends java.lang.Object
    A partition B = L U R of DFS oriented graph's back edges into two classes, referred to as left and right, is called left-right partition, or LR partition for short
    Author:
    Renata

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LRPartition(Graph<V,E> graph) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean createLRPartition()
      An LR partition is a partition of the back edges into Left and Right so that for every fork all return edges of e ending strictly higher than lowpt(e2) belong to one partition, and all return edges of e2 ending strictly higher than lowpt(e1) belong to the other.
      boolean createLRPartition(DFSTree<V,E> tree) 
      java.util.List<E> getLeft()
      Returns the left partition
      java.util.List<E> getRight()
      Returns the right partition

      void setRight(java.util.List<E> right) 
      java.lang.String toString()

      • LRPartition

        public LRPartition(Graph<V,E> graph)

    • Method Detail

      • createLRPartition

        public boolean createLRPartition()
        An LR partition is a partition of the back edges into Left and Right so that for every fork all return edges of e ending strictly higher than lowpt(e2) belong to one partition, and all return edges of e2 ending strictly higher than lowpt(e1) belong to the other.
        Returns:
        true if it can be partitioned, false otherwise

      • createLRPartition

        public boolean createLRPartition(DFSTree<V,E> tree)
        Parameters:
        tree - Tree whose back edges are being partitioned
        Returns:
        true if it can be partitioned, false otherwise

      • getRight

        public java.util.List<E> getRight()
        Returns the right partition
